sen.e: Chikurinin (竹林院, year of birth unknown - June 27, 1649) was a woman who lived from the Azuchi-Momoyama period to the Edo period.

sen.j: 真田信繁（幸村）の正室で、大谷吉継の娘（吉継の姪とも）。
sen.e: She was the lawful wife of Nobushige (Yukimura) SANADA, and was a daughter (or a niece) of Yoshitsugu OTANI.

sen.e: She gave birth to several children, such as Yukimasa SANADA, Morinobu SANADA, Aguri (married to Satoyoshi GAMO), Shobu (married to Sadahiro KATAKURA), and Okane (married to Sadakiyo ISHIKAWA).

sen.j: 父・吉継が真田家と交流が深く、1594年（文禄3年）頃に真田信繁に嫁ぐ。
sen.e: Her father Yoshitsugu associated deeply with the Sanada family, and around 1594 she got married to Nobushige SANADA.

sen.j: 1600年（慶長5年）12月、関ヶ原の戦いで西軍につき、信繁に随行して高野山に幽閉される。
sen.e: In December, 1600, because her family took the side of the West squad in the Battle of Sekigahara, she accompanied Nobushige to Koya-san Mountain and they were confined.

sen.j: 高野山での生活は厳しかったらしく、彼女自ら上田地方の紬技術を応用した真田紐を考案し、家臣たちに行商させて、生計を支えていた。
sen.e: The living on Koya-san Mountain seemed to be hard, and so she made use of the tsumugi (pongee) technique in person to originate Sanada-himo Ribbon, and made the vassals peddle them around to earn their living.

sen.j: 1615年（慶長20年）5月7日 (旧暦)に大坂夏の陣で信繁が戦死すると、徳川家康に命じられた紀伊領主・浅野長晟に捜索された。
sen.e: When Nobushige was killed in Osaka Natsu no Jin (Summer Siege of Osaka) on June 3, 1615, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA ordered Nagaakira ASANO, the feudal lord of Kii, to search for her.

sen.j: 5月20日 (旧暦)に紀伊伊都郡で娘のあぐりとともに3人の侍に警護されて隠れていたのを発見され、5月24日 (旧暦)に京都の家康に引き渡されたが、無罪となり以後は京都でかね夫婦と暮らす。
sen.e: On June 16, she was discovered hiding away with her daughter Aguri guarded by three samurai in Ito County, and on June 20, she was handed over to Ieyasu in Kyoto, but she was sentenced to innocence and from that time she lived with Kane's family in Kyoto.
